results.title: Around Australia: lure of the Flinders
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Depicts the beauty of the Flinders Range in South Australia. Tours Wilpena Pound, a great natural basin completely encircled by a massive mountain wall. Visits early settlents - Blinman, a thriving copper mining centre a century ago, and abandoned Kanyaka where mute evidence remains of pioneers’ hardships. Features a carpet of wild flowers, fossils, rugged mountain scenery and aboriginal rock carvings.

constellations_other.name: Webwurlds
constellations_other.description: Jess Johnson and Simon Ward's work is inspired by science fiction and fantasy. Johnson's hand-drawn illustrations are heavily detailed with geometric patterns and incorporate anthropomorphic characters amongst architectural environments in immersive other worlds.

results.title: Aroha
results.brief_description: Through the story of Aroha, daughter of a Maori chieftan, we see how the Maori people of New Zealand are integrating their ancient tribal customs with the ways of their non-Maori neighbours and progressing toward a fuller equality as citizens of New Zealand. Aroha, a student of Wellington University, is able to bring her people to a greater acceptance of the non-Maori’s ways when her father is brought back to health in a modern hospital. Depicts Maori customs and concludes with tribal dances. No other credits available.

results.title: Army ordnance
results.brief_description: Describes the functions of Ordnance in the Australian Army; how it supplies ammunition, transport, clothing, etc. Explains how equipment is manufactured by private firms and is thoroughly checked by Ordnance men before being sent to depots for storage. Shows the procedure for dealing with an order from receipt to final despatch.

results.title: Army apprentices school
results.brief_description: The Army Apprentices School at Balcombe, Victoria, offers training in numerous trades for a period of three years. For a further year boys are attached to an Army unit, and then the apprenticeship is completed and their qualifications as tradesmen will be recognized by civilian standards. This film illustrates the facilities offered for training in toolmaking, welding, carpentry, plumbing, blacksmithing, and machining. It points out that all apprentices are given theoretical training in English, Mathematics and trade science.

results.title: Arms race: where do we stand?
results.brief_description: Presented by Richard Morecroft, this thought-provoking program examines the important social issue of the arms race. Covers such topics as: the Maralinga tests, NATO and the Warsaw Pact, nuclear stockpiles, Australia’s defence forces policy, costs of war and the peace movement.

results.title: Armidale: provincial city
results.brief_description: Armidale is 300 miles north of Sydney in a district called New England. The film shows how the city owes its prosperity to the land, and includes a sequence on the University of New England.
